page.title: 16TRANSPORT
page.content: Shirwell is not serviced by public transport of any kind. (The only railway to run through the district was the line from Barnstaple to Lynton but this was 'axed' long before even the cuts of Dr. Beeching). There is, however, a market bus which covers the route from Lynton to Barnstaple (and return) twice a week and which will call in at points around the route provided that prior notice has been given. Many people are able to get 'lifts' into the town (Barnstaple) and shopping trips are often arranged when groups get together - yet another example of the typical, rural community spirit. One local farmer may often be seen riding along in a horse and trap.
